author: deme1744
content:
We've had to update the ENRs of the Nimbus mainnet bootstrap nodes as we've had their IP address changed. (see: https://github.com/eth2-clients/eth2-mainnet/pull/4 ). 
Additionally, I was testing the availability of all those mainnet bootstrap nodes and I noticed that message requests to both Lighthouse nodes and to the last three EF nodes time out each attempt. Does anyone else experience the same? Are they down?

author: .fjl
content: PSA: we will enable discv5 in geth for light client server nodes in the next release

author: .fjl
content: i.e. don't worry if your client sees ENRs with "eth" and "les" keys

author: protolambda
content: <@510413979080720385> libp2p requests or discv5? I'll check the EF bootnodes. They are just there for discv5 bootstrapping, and don't do libp2p

author: deme1744
content: discv5. I've tested by sending discv5 pings and findnode requests

author: protolambda
content: <@!510413979080720385> thanks for letting me know, bootnodes are healthy again now. Not sure what went wrong, looks like some of the docker containers froze for some reason, will investigate that.

author: deme1744
content: No problem. I can confirm that all 4 EF nodes are reachable again.
